title: Generation of B-cell-based cellular vaccine for cancer in murine models
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Isolation of lymphoid organs
Timing: 15 min per animal
This section describes the spleen and lymph node dissection.
Euthanize Bvax donor mice with CO2 according to institutional guidelines.
Intracardially perfuse mice with chilled PBS.
Prepare a 20 mL syringe with chilled PBS and a 25-guage needle.
With the animal pinned to the dissection board, access the thoracic cavity by cutting through the diaphragm and sternum.
Make an incision in the right atrium to allow blood to exit the circulation.
Enter the heart with the syringe through the left ventricle and perfuse the animal with cold PBS.
Note: Perfuse quickly after euthanasia to ensure the best perfusion.
Note: Proper perfusion requires approximately 10 mL of PBS, and the liver will turn from dark red to tan.
Identify the deep cervical lymph nodes and superficial cervical lymph nodes. The deep cervical lymph nodes are important as they drain the brain. Remove the lymph nodes and store them on a plate on ice with dissection media.
Note: Other lymph nodes, including inguinal and mesenteric lymph nodes, can also be collected.
Remove the spleen and store it on a plate on ice with sterile dissection media.
Note: Each well should have ∼2 mL of dissection media.
Isolation of B-cells from lymphoid organs
Timing: 1 h
This section describes the isolation of B-cells from lymphoid organs (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2581-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Schematic representation of B-cell isolation
(A) Representative cartoon of starting lymphocyte/spleenocyte population.
(B) Addition of B-cell isolation cocktail (step 11) leads to binding of biotinylated antibodies to all non-B-cells.
(C) Addition of streptavidin magnetic RapidSpheres binds all biotinylated antibodies (step 12).
(D) Magnetic isolation of RapidSpheres binds all non-B-cells to the walls of the magnet and leaves only B-cells in suspension (step 15).

Place a 70 μm sterile cell strainer (Fisherbrand cat# 22362548) on top of a 50 mL conical tube and rinse with 1 mL of cRPMI.
Place the spleen on the cell strainer and crush it with a 1 mL syringe plunger. Add 1–2 mL of cRPMI to rinse the cells through the filter.
Note: Use a new strainer for each spleen to prevent strainer clogging.
Note: Multiple lymph nodes can be pooled into the same strainer (up to 10 lymph nodes).
Adjust the volume to 10 mL for each tube with cRPMI and centrifuge (300 × g, 5 min, at 4°C). Discard supernatant.
Resuspend the disassociated splenocytes and lymphocytes at 100 M cells per 950 μL MACS Buffer per spleen. Filter the cells through a 70 μm sterile cell strainer into a new 50 mL conical tube.
Note: Make sure to keep the MACS Buffer chilled.
Note: The isolation protocol can be scaled accordingly if starting with significantly fewer cells.
Add 50 μL of rat serum (Included in the B-cell Isolation Kit) per 100 M cells.
Transfer into a 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tube, up to 1 mL per tube. Discard the caps of the tubes.
Add 50 μL of B-cell isolation cocktail per mL of sample and incubate at room temperature for 10 min.
Vortex the RapidSpheres for 30 s, ensuring the solution is mixed well. After incubation with B-cell Isolation Cocktail, add 75 μL of RapidSpheres per mL of sample. Mix and incubate at room temperature for 2.5 min (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2581-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Total B-cell negative isolation and 4-1BBL+ B-cell positive isolation

(A–F) Photo guide for magnetic isolation of B-cells (A–C) and 4-1BBL+ B-cells (D–F) (A) Addition of 75 μL of RapidSpheres per 1 mL of sample in 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tube. Mix and incubate at room temperature for 2.5 min (step 12). (B) Place 5 mL round bottom polystyrene tube in STEMCELL EasySep Magnet. Incubate at room temperature for 2.5 min (step 14). (C) Using a filtered 5 mL pipette tip slowly pick up remaining liquid, being sure not to touch the back of the tube nearest to the magnet. Dispense B-cells into a 50 mL conical tube (step 15). (D) Set up the Miltenyi MS Columns in the OctoMACS separator on the magnetic stand. Set up 15 mL conical tubes under each column to collect the negative fraction (step 22). (E) Place a 70 μm strainer on top of each column and add up to 500 μL of B-cell suspension through the strainer. Wait until all liquid flows through the column (step 24). (F) Add 1 mL of MACS Buffer to each column and push down firmly with the plunger included with the column packaging. Wait until all bubbles flow out of the column (step 28).
Bring the volume for each tube to 2.5 mL by adding 1.375 mL of MACS Buffer.
Note: If the protocol was scaled down, increase the amount of MACS Buffer added to bring the final volume to 2.5 mL.
Place the tube without the lid into the STEMCELL EasySep magnet and incubate at room temperature for 2.5 min (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]B).
Using a filtered 5 mL pipette tip, carefully pipette the remaining liquid and dispense it into a 50 mL conical tube. Note that the remaining cells attached to the magnet are all unwanted non-B-cells (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]C).

Increase the volume of the cell suspension to 10 mL with MACS Buffer and count cells.
Note: The expected total B-cell count is ∼40 M per animal. Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.1].
Isolation of 4-1BBL+ B-cells from total B-cells
Timing: 1 h
This step is for the positive isolation of 4-1BBL+ B-cells from the total B-cell population. Keep the negative fraction, as cells can be re-isolated in case of error.
Resuspend total B-cells in 10 M per 100 μL MACS Buffer in a 50 mL conical tube.
Add 1 μL of Biotin anti-mouse 4-1BBL Ligand (CD137L) antibody per 1 M B-cells (0.5 μg antibody per 1 M B-cells.
Note: Always add at least 5 μL of antibody, even if fewer than 5 M cells.
Incubate B-cells for 10 min at 4°C.
Increase the volume to 25 mL with MACS Buffer and centrifuge (300 × g, 10 min, at 4°C). Discard the supernatant.
Resuspend less than or equal to 100 M B-cells in 500 μL of MACS Buffer.
Note: Exceeding 100 M B-cells per 500 μL of MACS Buffer can obstruct magnetic isolation.
Note: If working with more than 100 M B-cells, use multiple Miltenyi MS columns to process the cells.
Column isolation
Prepare Miltenyi MS columns in the OctoMACS separator on the magnetic stand with 15 mL conical tubes under each column to collect the negative fraction (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]D).
Note: Each MS column can process up to 200 M total cells and 10 M 4-1BBL+ cells.
Wet each column with 500 μL of MACS Buffer.
Place a 70 μm strainer on top of each column and pipette 500 μL of B-cell suspension through the strainer. Wait until all liquid flows through the column (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]E).
Add 500 μL of MACS Buffer to each column to wash the remaining B-cells through.

Wait until the liquid flows through and repeat a total of 3×.
Remove the column from the magnet and place it in a new 15 mL conical tube to collect the 4-1BBL+ B-cells.
Add 1 mL of MACS Buffer into each column and allow the liquid to flow.
Add 1 mL of MACS Buffer to each column and push down firmly with the plunger included with the column (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]F).
Note: Wait until all bubbles flow out of the column for maximum cell retention.
Resuspend 2 M 4-1BBL+ B-cells per 1 mL of cRPMI. Troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.3].
Add BAFF at 100 ng/mL.
Add anti-CD40 at 5 μg/mL.
Incubate at 37°C for 24 h.
Add IFNγ (2 ng/mL) the following day and continue incubating at 37°C for 24 h.
Note: After 48 h of culture, B-cells should expand in size and begin aggregating.
Note: Expected viability after the culture is ∼75%. Troubleshooting 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5].
Bvax tumor-antigen loading
Timing: 6 h
This step is for generating CT2A tumor lysates and preparing Bvax for injection.
Lift CT2A tumor cells from the culture plate using ∼1–3 mL of trypsin.
Resuspend 10 M CT2A cells per 1 mL of PBS.
Aliquot 10 M CT2A cells per 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes.
Free-thaw each 1 mL aliquot in liquid nitrogen and a 42°C water bath.
Repeat the free-thaw cycle x5.
Following freeze-thaw cycling, place 1 mL aliquot in an ultrasonic cleaner for 60 s.
Centrifuge on a tabletop centrifuge at >16,000 × g for 15 min.
Following centrifugation, collect the supernatant for tumor lysate and discard the remaining pellet.
Note: Tumor lysates can be prepared ahead of time and stored in a −80°C freezer.
Add 100 μL tumor lysate per 1 M plated B-cells.
Incubate cells at 37°C for 4 h.
Note: After incubation, cells should form aggregates.

When ready to administer, collect B-cells and wash x2 using PBS.
Note: Bvax is now ready for downstream therapeutic use.
Bvax injections and glioma-bearing mice survival evaluation
Timing: 9 d
This step is for the injection of Bvax into glioma-bearing mice.
For the treatment of gliomas, Bvax are injected via retro-orbital intravenous (IV) injection every 3 days at 2 M Bvax per dose for 3 doses. Troubleshooting 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.7].
Note: Bvax are resuspended in sterile PBS at 2 M cells per 150 μL of PBS or saline.
Note: Animals receive thermal support during the procedure per institutional IACUC guidelines.
Monitor animals until awake and ambulatory.
Monitor animals at least 2× per week for any signs of complications from Bvax injection.
Assess body weight and condition for hunched posture, slower movements, weight loss, and/or body condition score of 2.
Examine animals for functional defects due to tumor burden, including the inability to maintain an upright position, spasticity, seizures, circling, paralysis, paresis, or inability to access food/water.
Examine animals for other early termination endpoint criteria including those stated in the IACUC-approved body condition scoring system and significant weight loss.
Bvax functional assessment (in-vitro CD8+ T-cell proliferation assay)
Timing: 3 d
This step is for the functional assessment to determine the proliferation of Bvax.
Harvest the spleen and lymph nodes of another tumor-bearing mouse in the same manner as steps 1–4.
T-cells must have shared cognate antigen specificity as those being presented by Bvax. If Bvax was generated from peptide-vaccinated animals, use a peptide-vaccinated animal for T-cell isolation.
Isolate CD8+ T-cells using the EasySep Mouse CD8+ T-cell Isolation Kit (STEMCELL Technologies Cat# 19853).
The steps for CD8+ T-cell isolation are the same as those of B-cell isolation (steps 5–16).

Note: Before magnetic isolation, use 125 μL of RapidSpheres per mL of sample (rather than 75 μL, step 12) and 1.325 mL MACS Buffer (rather than 1.375 mL, step 13).
Note: Expected number of CD8+ T-cells is ∼8 M per spleen.
Wash T-cells 2× with PBS and resuspend up to 10 M CD8+ T-cells in 500 μL PBS.
Reconstitute eBioscience Cell Proliferation Dye eFluor450 (Thermo Fisher Scientific Cat# 65-0842-85) to a stock concentration of 10 mM with DMSO.
Prepare a 20 μM working solution in 500 μL PBS.
Mix the CD8+ T-cells with the Proliferation Dye in a 1:1 v:v ratio by gently swirling to ensure even dye distribution throughout the CD8+ T-cell suspension.
After adding dye, protect T-cells from light.
Incubate T-cells for 10 min at 37°C.
Increase the volume up to 10 mL with cRPMI and place on ice for 5 min to deactivate the Proliferation Dye.
Wash 2× with cRPMI and resuspend at 1 M CD8+ cells in 1 mL of cRPMI.
After Bvax are pulsed with antigen (see steps 40–41), wash with cRPMI, and resuspend at 1 M Bvax/mL cRPMI.
Plate 100 μL of Bvax in a 96-well Clear Round Bottom Microplate.
Add 100 μL of CD8+ T-cells on top of the Bvax.
Note: Total volume after this step should be 200 μL and cell density 1 M cells/mL.
Add recombinant IL-2 (30 U/mL; Peprotech Cat# 212-12).
Incubate at 37°C for 72 h.
Assess CD8+ T-cell proliferation via flow cytometry analysis of Cell Proliferation Dye eFluor450. Troubleshooting 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9].
